text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Occitanie | native_name = | native_name_lang = fr | settlement_type = Region of France | image_skyline = | image_caption = | image_flag = Flag_of_Région_Occitanie_Perpinyà_variation.svg | flag_size = 120px | image_shield = Blason région fr Occitanie.svg | shield_size = | image_blank_emblem = | blank_emblem_size = | image_map = Occitanie in France 2016.svg | map_caption = | motto = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat_type = Prefecture | seat = Toulouse | parts_type = Departments | parts_style = list | parts = 13 | p1 = Ariège (09) | p2 = Aude (11) | p3 = Aveyron (12) | p4 = Gard (30) | p5 = Gers (32) | p6 = Haute-Garonne (31) | p7 = Hautes-Pyrénées (65) | p8 = Hérault (34) | p9 = Lot (46) | p10 = Lozère (48) | p11 = Pyrénées-Orientales (66) | p12 = Tarn (81) | p13 = Tarn-et-Garonne (82) | p14 = | leader_party = PS | leader_title = President of the Regional Council | leader_name = Carole Delga | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 72724 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 5774185 | population_as_of = 2015 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = Occitans | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01:00 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +02:00 | blank_name_sec1 = GDP () | blank_info_sec1 = Ranked | blank1_name_sec1 = Total | blank1_info_sec1 = € billion (US$ bn) | blank2_name_sec1 = Per capita | blank2_info_sec1 = € (US$) | blank_name_sec2 = NUTS Region | blank_info_sec2 = | website = | iso_code = FR-OCC | footnotes = }} Occitanie (, ) is an administrative region of France. It was created on 1 January 2016 from the former French regions Languedoc-Roussillon and Midi-Pyrénées. The name in French, Occitanie, was approved as the new name of the region on 28 September 2016. The new Occitanie Region is the main part of a wider cultural entity known as Occitania. This wider region once included part of Spain (Aran Valley), and Monaco, and parts of Italy (the Occitan Valleys and Guardia Piemontese). This wider area used to speak Occitan as their first language. ==Geography== The Occitanie region is the third largest region of France, after Nouvelle-Aquitaine and French Guiana, and the second of Metropolitan France with an area of . It is in southern France (the Midi) and borders to the south with Spain and Andorra; it also borders three French regions: Nouvelle-Aquitaine to the west, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes to the north, Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur to the east. The Mediterranean Sea is to the southeast. Its capital, Toulouse, is at to the southwest of Paris, the national capital, at to the west of Marseille, at to the southeast of Bordeaux and at to the north of Barcelona (Spain). ===Rivers=== There are two main drainage basin in the region; some rivers in those basins are: * Atlantic basin * Garonne river is long but, in the region it is long, more than half its total length. *** Tarn **** Aveyron **** Agout *** Lot *** Ariège *** Gers * Mediterranean basin ** Tech ** Têt ** Agly ** Aude ** Rhône ===Mountains=== The Pic Vignemale (), at , is the highest mountain of the Occitanie region; it is on the border with Spain. It is in the Pyrénées National Park. The highest point of the different departments of the Occitanie region are: Department Mountain Elevation Ariège Pica d'Estats Aude Pic de Madrès Aveyron Signal de Mailhe-Biau Gard Mont Aigoual Haute-Garonne Perdiguero Gers Mont de Chapelle Saint Roch Hérault Valbonne Lot Signal de Labastide-du-Haut-Mont Lozère Mont Lozère Hautes-Pyrénées Pic Vignemale Pyrénées-Orientales Pic Carlit Tarn Puech de Rascas Tarn-et-Garonne Puech des Carts-Sommet Nord ==Departments== The Occitanie region is formed by 13 departments: ISO 3166-2 Shield Department Prefecture Arr.
